MONL.content: prosthesis of origin: prior-to-the-first time of pre-originary language, must be invented
MONL.linkedContent: prosthesis of origin: prior-to-the-first time of pre-originary language, must be invented

AF.content: nearly ecstatic instant Freud dreams of [re: Studies on Hysteria]: origin speaking by itself, arkhē appears in the nude, w/out archive, anamnēsis w/out hypomnēsis
AF.linkedContent: nearly ecstatic instant Freud dreams of [re: Studies on Hysteria]: origin speaking by itself, arkhē appears in the nude, w/out archive, anamnēsis w/out hypomnēsis

OOG.content: for Husserl, aprioriness is not a concern, it is the institutive infinitization
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, aprioriness is not a concern, it is the institutive infinitization

HERP.content: irreducible, nonformalizable equivocation/inconsistency in Heidegger’s use of “originary” or “nonoriginary” [from 1933-1955] > nonformalizable character insufficiently thematized—thus the political strategies play out, stop, carry along
HERP.linkedContent: irreducible, nonformalizable equivocation/inconsistency in Heidegger’s use of “originary” or “nonoriginary” [from 1933-1955] > nonformalizable character insufficiently thematized—thus the political strategies play out, stop, carry along

HERP.content: acc. Heidegger, originary strife projects what is not yet heard
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, originary strife projects what is not yet heard

POOF.content: to wonder how something could be born from its antithesis, whether truth is born of error, one must be mad in eyes of ‘metaphysicians of all ages’ > one must go mad asking about an impossible genesis, one that contradicts its very origin, an anti-genesis [Derrida on Nietzsche]
POOF.linkedContent: to wonder how something could be born from its antithesis, whether truth is born of error, one must be mad in eyes of ‘metaphysicians of all ages’ > one must go mad asking about an impossible genesis, one that contradicts its very origin, an anti-genesis [Derrida on Nietzsche]

MPM.content: de Man treats all historicism, periodization, narrative of origin as fables, fictions
MPM.linkedContent: de Man treats all historicism, periodization, narrative of origin as fables, fictions

VP.content: tradition assured to infinity > transmission and reactivation of origin; this is a valuation, an ethico-theoretical act, reawakening originary decision of philosophy as Platonic form
VP.linkedContent: tradition assured to infinity > transmission and reactivation of origin; this is a valuation, an ethico-theoretical act, reawakening originary decision of philosophy as Platonic form

SPOM.content: it has always been acceleration itself [beyond the norms of speed that have until now informed human culture] that dislocates, dislocation no less arch-originary than archaism it dislodges
SPOM.linkedContent: it has always been acceleration itself [beyond the norms of speed that have until now informed human culture] that dislocates, dislocation no less arch-originary than archaism it dislodges

SPOM.content: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism
SPOM.linkedContent: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism

VM.content: Being makes search for an archia tremble, its priority is not an archia
VM.linkedContent: Being makes search for an archia tremble, its priority is not an archia

S.content: origin as hétérogène à l’origine: 1) originarily heterogenous 2) heterogenous to what is called the origin, other than the origin 3) heterogenous and or insofar as at the origin: because and although (bien que) at the same time—is logical form of tension that makes this thought vibrate; p. 109 is this just the spirit of Christianity?
S.linkedContent: origin as hétérogène à l’origine: 1) originarily heterogenous 2) heterogenous to what is called the origin, other than the origin 3) heterogenous and or insofar as at the origin: because and although (bien que) at the same time—is logical form of tension that makes this thought vibrate; p. 109 is this just the spirit of Christianity?

FSW.content: differance as non-originary origin, erases myth of origin, determined outside teleological/eschatological horizon [horizon key word here]
FSW.linkedContent: differance as non-originary origin, erases myth of origin, determined outside teleological/eschatological horizon [horizon key word here]

FSW.content: labor of writing erases distinction btwn origin of world and Being-in-the-World
FSW.linkedContent: labor of writing erases distinction btwn origin of world and Being-in-the-World

TC.content: Artaud: spirit of beginnings, which is the Christian spirit, has not ceased to make me commit idiocies
TC.linkedContent: Artaud: spirit of beginnings, which is the Christian spirit, has not ceased to make me commit idiocies

PPHS.content: origin, inaugural imaginary limit, myth of transcendental signified, archeology before trace and difference
PPHS.linkedContent: origin, inaugural imaginary limit, myth of transcendental signified, archeology before trace and difference

SH.content: poetry, literature, art, experience of the mask, an intense familiarity w/ ineluctable originarity of specter = ineluctable loss of origin > spectral errancy of words not an accident

POS.content: how the “fall,” abasement (of writing) only functions via thought of origin
POS.linkedContent: how the “fall,” abasement (of writing) only functions via thought of origin

GSP.content: the attempt parallelism makes to overcome invisible difference is not innocent: for Husserl, the nothing of a parallelism prevents transcendental phenomenology & phenomenological psychology from coming together, this nothing permits transcendental reduction: permits origin of world to appear
GSP.linkedContent: the attempt parallelism makes to overcome invisible difference is not innocent: for Husserl, the nothing of a parallelism prevents transcendental phenomenology & phenomenological psychology from coming together, this nothing permits transcendental reduction: permits origin of world to appear

GSP.content: Husserl: transcendental ‘Absolute’ is not ultimate, it constitutes itself and has the ultimately, truly absolute as its primeval source (Urquelle)
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl: transcendental ‘Absolute’ is not ultimate, it constitutes itself and has the ultimately, truly absolute as its primeval source (Urquelle)

TB.content: classic circle always begins to turn once one asks about origin of languages/society
TB.linkedContent: classic circle always begins to turn once one asks about origin of languages/society

TB.content: if axiom “there is no translation of translation” were broken, one would touch, and one must not, the untouchable of the untouchable (that which guarantees originality to the original)
TB.linkedContent: if axiom “there is no translation of translation” were broken, one would touch, and one must not, the untouchable of the untouchable (that which guarantees originality to the original)

TB.content: Rousseau, Husserl & Benjamin seek origin even while dismissing historical/natural one [?]

TB.content: Benjamin: “concept of origin (Abstammugsbegriff) remains indispensable” [re: affinity of languages]

DST.content: great task of translator, his agony, aporias, madness: proceed from initial strangeness, the gap opened by idiom of original text [original text?????]

DST.linkedContent: if one no longer denounces mimesis as fallen, [contra Plato], can’t call it originary: being originary incompatible w/ mimesis

D.content: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)
D.linkedContent: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)

LI.content: vices [turns] that interest me: time & place of the other time, the other time in (stead of) the first time, at once
LI.linkedContent: vices [turns] that interest me: time & place of the other time, the other time in (stead of) the first time, at once

TN.content: Merleau-Ponty’s originary here, origin of world, an “I can”
TN.linkedContent: Merleau-Ponty’s originary here, origin of world, an “I can”

WOG.content: deconstruction at work in the ‘origin,’ already from the ‘origin’ itself—upon deconstruction of the origin
WOG.linkedContent: deconstruction at work in the ‘origin,’ already from the ‘origin’ itself—upon deconstruction of the origin

OG.content: transcendental arche must make its necessity felt before letting itself be erased, arche-trace must comply w/ this necessity & erasure (contradictory and not acceptable in logic of identity), it is the disappearance of origin, and also the origin of origin, so to wrench (arracher) trace from classical scheme that would demand it comes after originary nontrace (that would make of it an empirical mark), we must speak of originary trace or arche-trace > but if all begins w/ trace, there’s no originary trace
OG.linkedContent: transcendental arche must make its necessity felt before letting itself be erased, arche-trace must comply w/ this necessity & erasure (contradictory and not acceptable in logic of identity), it is the disappearance of origin, and also the origin of origin, so to wrench (arracher) trace from classical scheme that would demand it comes after originary nontrace (that would make of it an empirical mark), we must speak of originary trace or arche-trace > but if all begins w/ trace, there’s no originary trace

OG.content: question of origin at first merges w/ essence [re: what is writing?] > though writing is thoroughly historical, surprising [?] that scientific study of writing has always taken form of a history of writing
OG.linkedContent: question of origin at first merges w/ essence [re: what is writing?] > though writing is thoroughly historical, surprising [?] that scientific study of writing has always taken form of a history of writing

OG.content: no law w/out possibility of trace, what is lost in thought of trace (complicity of origins, arche-writing) is the myth of the simplicity of origin
OG.linkedContent: no law w/out possibility of trace, what is lost in thought of trace (complicity of origins, arche-writing) is the myth of the simplicity of origin

OG.content: origin/nature as myth of addition, supplementarity annulled by being purely additive > myth of the effacement of the trace
OG.linkedContent: origin/nature as myth of addition, supplementarity annulled by being purely additive > myth of the effacement of the trace

OG.content: Rousseau declares what he wishes to say: writing/articulation are post-originary malady; he describes what he does not wish to say: articulation (space of writing) at origin of language
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau declares what he wishes to say: writing/articulation are post-originary malady; he describes what he does not wish to say: articulation (space of writing) at origin of language

OG.content: what he describes takes place for better or worse, annuls eschatology & teleology just as differance (originary articulation) annuls archeology
OG.linkedContent: what he describes takes place for better or worse, annuls eschatology & teleology just as differance (originary articulation) annuls archeology

OG.content: natural immediacy is à la fois origine et fin, in the double sense of birth & death, unfinished sketch and finished perfection (esquisse inachevée et perfection finie) [how Rousseau’s contradiction is only apparent, how his law of concept of nature constrains natural law]
OG.linkedContent: natural immediacy is à la fois origine et fin, in the double sense of birth & death, unfinished sketch and finished perfection (esquisse inachevée et perfection finie) [how Rousseau’s contradiction is only apparent, how his law of concept of nature constrains natural law]

OG.content: complexity of zero degree, origin, nothing but a point in the system of supplementarity? [despite what he declares, nothing Rousseau writes authorizes simple origin]
OG.linkedContent: complexity of zero degree, origin, nothing but a point in the system of supplementarity? [despite what he declares, nothing Rousseau writes authorizes simple origin]

OG.content: history of language as history du supplément d’origine
[in Rousseau’s archeo-teleology] origin & end are inertia

[vis-à-vis Rousseau] teleology as external—passage from state of nature to state of language (from one structure to another) explained by catastrophic archaeology (catastrophe of dangerous supplementarity)
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] teleology as external—passage from state of nature to state of language (from one structure to another) explained by catastrophic archaeology (catastrophe of dangerous supplementarity)

OG.content: is the catastrophe that splits nature still natural?
OG.linkedContent: is the catastrophe that splits nature still natural?

OG.content: for Rousseau, birth of society not a passage but a pure, fictive, unstable point > post-originary degradation analogous to pre-originary repetition
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, birth of society not a passage but a pure, fictive, unstable point > post-originary degradation analogous to pre-originary repetition

OG.content: if culture is broached w/in its point of origin—no linear order > morrow = eve of festival
OG.linkedContent: if culture is broached w/in its point of origin—no linear order > morrow = eve of festival

OG.content: for Rousseau, though poet lacks objective truth of object, he comes closer to authenticity/literalness than rhetor/writer > poet speaks from origin of his passionate speech
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, though poet lacks objective truth of object, he comes closer to authenticity/literalness than rhetor/writer > poet speaks from origin of his passionate speech

SPEC.content: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)
SPEC.linkedContent: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)

SPEC.content: [fort:da is a narrative] no thesis, only hypothesis, origin is speculative because the object cannot be the object of a thesis
SPEC.linkedContent: [fort:da is a narrative] no thesis, only hypothesis, origin is speculative because the object cannot be the object of a thesis
